intro: Inula odora, commonly known as sweet William, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its most notable feature is the fragrant, pink or white flower heads that bloom in late summer. Inula odora is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
